title: Lasagna Flatbread Recipe
description: Give lasagna a quick and easy pizza makeover by baking sausage, ricotta, marinara sauce, and mozzarella on flatbreads.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Bread Quick Bread Recipes Lasagna Flatbread 4.5 (42) 31 Reviews 7 Photos A simple lasagna pizza. Submitted by apk979 Updated on November 10, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 (15 ounce) container ricotta cheese 1 (8 ounce) package shredded mozzarella cheese, divided 1 (3 ounce) package Parmesan cheese 1 egg 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning 1 pound sausage ½ (26 ounce) jar marinara sauce 6 flatbreads Directions Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Combine ricotta cheese, 1/2 of the mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, and Italian seasoning in a bowl. Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, 5 to 10 minutes; drain. Stir in marinara sauce. Spread 1/6 of the cheese mixture evenly on each flatbread; cover with sausage mixture. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, 10 to 15 minutes. Cook's Notes: Cottage cheese can be substituted for the ricotta cheese if desired. Hamburger can be substituted for the sausage. I Made It Print 168 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 602 Calories 37g Fat 31g Carbs 44g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 602 % Daily Value * Total Fat 37g 47% Saturated Fat 16g 80% Cholesterol 134mg 45% Sodium 1679mg 73% Total Carbohydrate 31g 11% Dietary Fiber 11g 39% Total Sugars 6g Protein 44g 88% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 683mg 53% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 537mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Lasagna Flatbread 01 of 07 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 07 Photo by  Cris T 03/19/2020 03 of 07 Photo by  Melissa Hazelett 02/19/2020 04 of 07 Photo by  Paul 11/24/2018 05 of 07 Photo by  Mary Pat Murray Chiswick 11/11/2018 06 of 07 Photo by  lutzflcat 10/11/2016 10.11.16 I used garlic naan bread, mild Italian sausage, and my homemade marinara sauce. I must say that the ricotta in the cheese base really does make this taste a bit like lasagna. The mozzarella on top did take a while to brown up, so I'll bump up the temperature to 400° next time. Quick and easy lunch today....and tasty, too! 1 You’ll Also Love Grandma Rosie's Extra Smooth Spaghetti Sauce 4 Ratings Pasta/Pizza Sauce 131 Ratings Easy Homemade Pizza Sauce 566 Ratings Canning Tomato Sauce from Fresh Tomatoes 15 Ratings Homemade Pizza Sauce with Olive Oil 14 Ratings Essanaye's Pizza Sauce 45 Ratings Pizza Sauce I 97 Ratings Exquisite Pizza Sauce 2,940 Ratings Homemade Pizza Sauce Made Lighter 4 Ratings Delicious Pizza Sauce Recipe 35 Ratings Easy Pizza Sauce from Tomato Sauce 214 Ratings Spicy Roasted Tomato and Ricotta Pasta Sauce 2 Ratings Spaghetti Sauce II 422 Ratings Grandma's Sunday Sauce Basic Marinara for the Instant Pot 16 Ratings Instant Pot Turkey Bolognese 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Combine ricotta cheese, 1/2 of the mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, and Italian seasoning in a bowl.;Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, 5 to 10 minutes; drain. Stir in marinara sauce.;Spread 1/6 of the cheese mixture evenly on each flatbread; cover with sausage mixture. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese.;Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, 10 to 15 minutes.
